Articles.Content: Can external camera shake be turned off?
Also, is Nassault going to help with the release trailer this time?

The expanded physics bubble in atmosphere is a great idea. Hope it makes stage recovery more feasible.

Also, get well soon Kasper!

yes, HarvesteR mentioned that in last weeks Devnotes

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Can external camera shake be turned off?

Forgot to include the quote I was answering.

If you do a proper gravity turn (and if the aero update is what I think it will be) then you should never be dropping boosters while over KSC. Also, you can get 22km away from a booster pretty quick. I would be surprised if most of my rockets had to worry about the boosters hitting the ground before getting out of the 22.5km window.

Also, parachutes would make the boosters take longer to get to the ground, further increasing the chance that you'll be too far away before they hit it.

> 
> Can external camera shake be turned off?

Yes. HarvesteR said this last week in a reply to the devnotes. I think he even edited the OP.

> 
> If you do a proper gravity turn (and if the aero update is what I think it will be) then you should never be dropping boosters while over KSC. Also, you can get 22km away from a booster pretty quick. I would be surprised if most of my rockets had to worry about the boosters hitting the ground before getting out of the 22.5km window.
> Also, parachutes would make the boosters take longer to get to the ground, further increasing the chance that you'll be too far away before they hit it.

Your exactly right. 22.5 is nice, but its not enough to simulate a SpaceX boost back or barge landing and at the same time still put something into orbit. You might get away with recovering some srbs's in that little window as you said with a steep flight, but that's it as far as rocket reusability goes. Ive been playing with BDArmory which increases your load distance. I changed it to 300 km. That was fun. However that brings me to my next concern. 

How are those floating point errors with that 22.5 load distance? Because in my game things start to shake around that distance if you change to and from vessels. And its gets worse the farther you get. 

And it makes me wonder if the 64bit client can better handle that.

> 
> Regarding the cursor, maybe I'm weird, but I prefer all cursors to be identical on my machine. I play windowed, though.

Me too, I've never cared much for custom cursors, I hope we get to choose whether or not to use it.
How about no custom cursors? Or at least make it an option, I like my uniformity.

@ HarvesteR

The new phys bubble being bigger : good. Being 22,5 km top ? Not good ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) It is still too little ... it will surely help in some situations, but will still most likely bork any kind of plane assisted launch :/

On the tech tree being visible: TBH I find it funny you got there, especially since one of the persons that posted in the the same post as you today said to me a couple of months ago that you ( devs ) didn't wanted to put information about future science on screen because " it would spoil the joy of discovery ". It looks like saner views ended prevailing ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

The physics bubble expansion is a great idea but I hope it's configurable or at least readily moddable, since the one major drawback is stuff parked on the ground needs to be moved a lot further away to prevent it causing lag.

I also trust the custom cursor will be an option. It varies by game but often I find fancy cursors don't feel as responsive as the standard ones in the operating system.

Great devnotes! Visual survey contracts should be much easier to complete now that plane parts are available earlier in the game, and I'm already thinking of things that can be done in 1.0 with the increased Physics Bubble! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If you use the real chute mod, you can arm the parachute on staging (rather than deploying) and the new bubble will probably let it land if the chutes open close to the ground. You just might be able to recover them.

If you're looking at the cursor, presumably this also means that you'll be changing cursors at appropriate places? By which I mean, I hope there's going to be some form of double-headed up/down arrow when hovering over the top or bottom of the contracts window (whichever is the free end) to indicate that it can be stretched?

It took me ***far*** too long to realise that the window could be resized vertically because I kept hovering my mouse over the appropriate area but didn't *try* doing anything because the cursor didn't change.
Also, a big QoL issue, will we be getting a [QuickScroll](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/95168-0-90-Malah-s-Quick-mods) like stock feature?
